author: .paulharris
content:
Theres a PR up to rename but I'm kind of stuck on progressing it. outstanding issue was to rename through consensus-specs so I did that but it went about as well as can be expected...
My hope was that once we finish the rename we can just use deneb, and stop polluting with eip everywhere

author: arnetheduck
content: indeed, I'm interested first and foremost in consensus-specs so we can get the ball rolling

author: funnygiulio
content: is there a way to speed up attestation processing, like skipping beacon committee computation? I am talking about the context of historical states computation. I see it takes a lot of time for the computation to occur and it seems vital for the state transition itself. perhaps I am missing something but is there any way it can be skipped?

author: funnygiulio
content: actually I have an idea, nevermind

author: sproul
content: are you going to try storing a committee cache per epoch? last time I tried this the time to load the cache was roughly the same as the time to build it, but things may have changed with more validators (and you might have a slight edge with MDBX)

author: funnygiulio
content: yes that is what I did

author: funnygiulio
content: it was a dumb solution lol
